intro: Lachenalia patula, commonly known as the narrow-leaved lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Lachenalia patula thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in suitable climates.
